biography.bio: At age 16, Annabella was chosen by Abel Gance to appear in Napoleon (1927). In the 30s, she became a star of French movies. She made movies in numerous other countries, before being called to Hollywood in 1938, where she met and married Tyrone Power. She remained in the USA until 1947. Then she attempted a comeback in France. She retired from show business in 1954.
biography.name: Annabella

biography.bio: Victor Francen was born on August 5, 1888 in Tienen, Flanders, Belgium as Victor Franssen. He was an actor, known for La fin du jour (1939), Hold Back the Dawn (1941) and Hell and High Water (1954). He was married to Eleanor Kreutzer, Renée Corciade and Mary Marquet. He died on November 18, 1977 in Aix-en-Provence, Bouches-du-Rhône, France.
biography.name: Victor Francen

biography.bio: Gabriel Signoret was born on November 15, 1878 in Marseille, Bouches-du-Rhône, France as Marius Augustin Signoret. He was an actor, known for Prométhée... banquier (1921), Ménilmontant (1936) and Sacrifice d'honneur (1935). He died on March 16, 1937 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Gabriel Signoret

biography.bio: Pierre Renoir was born on March 21, 1885 in Paris, France. He was an actor, known for Children of Paradise (1945), La Marseillaise (1938) and La nuit du carrefour (1932). He was married to Sergine, Vera. He died on March 11, 1952 in Paris.
biography.name: Pierre Renoir

biography.bio: Rosine Deréan was born on February 23, 1910 in Paris, France. She was an actress, known for The Story of a Cheat (1936), The Two Orphans (1933) and Ladies Lake (1934). She was married to Claude Dauphin. She died on March 14, 2001 in Genille, Indre-et-Loire, France.
biography.name: Rosine Deréan

biography.bio: Jean Dunot was born on November 14, 1906 in Montlhéry, France as Xavier Joseph Alfred Taminau. He was an actor, known for Four Bags Full (1956), Quai des Orfèvres (1947) and Sacrifice d'honneur (1935). He died on January 29, 1968 in Draveil, France.
biography.name: Jean Dunot

biography.bio: Maurice Baquet is a multi-talented man: gifted cellist (1st prize at the Conservatoire de Paris), Skier (member of the 1936 French Olympic Team), mountain climber(this talent used in several movies, including 'Premier de Cordée'). He attracted poet 'Jacques Prevet''s attention when riding on his bicycle, holding his cello, and soon joigned Prevert's famed theather Octobre group. Movies followed rapidly, and he became a favorite of the French public. He has been active in several fields, outside of movies: a one-man show, music-hall, operettas (most of them with Luis Mariano; one of them was filmed - Andalousie (1951). He appeared on Broadway ('My aunt's feather', with Liliane Montevecchi), and on the London stage. A great friend of famed photographer Robert Doineau, he wrote "Ballade pour violoncelle et chambre noire" adorned with magnificent photos of himself by Doisneau.
biography.name: Maurice Baquet

biography.bio: Léon Arvel was born on April 29, 1873 in Paris, France as Léon Adler. He was an actor, known for Diary of a Country Priest (1951), La tragédie de Belgrade (1909) and Le paquebot Tenacity (1934). He died on June 26, 1956 in Paris.
biography.name: Léon Arvel

biography.bio: Raymond Narlay was born on November 29, 1882 in Paris, France as Paul Georges Emler. He was an actor, known for Sacrifice d'honneur (1935), The Temporary Gentleman (1929) and Le tourbillon de Paris (1928). He died on August 18, 1958 in Poitiers, Vienne, France.
biography.name: Raymond Narlay

biography.bio: Lucien Walter was born on February 5, 1866 in Paris, France as Eugène Lucien Alfred Bollender. He was an actor, known for Le mouchoir de Marie (1908), Sacrifice d'honneur (1935) and Un homme sans nom (1932). He died on February 17, 1945 in Paris.
biography.name: Lucien Walter

biography.bio: Roland Toutain was born on October 18, 1905 in Paris, France. He is known for his work on The Rules of the Game (1939), The Mystery of the Yellow Room (1930) and Liliom (1934). He died on October 16, 1977 in Argenteuil, Val-d'Oise, France.
biography.name: Roland Toutain

biography.bio: Robert Vidalin was born on March 5, 1903 in Saint-Amant-Tallende, France. He was an actor, known for Le bossu (1934), Les misérables (1934) and Napoleon (1927). He died on December 3, 1989 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Robert Vidalin
